title: Fragment of an imperial honorific
support: A thick white marble plaque, broken in half vertically, preserving left edge with two clamp holes (with rust staining), at 16 and 54.5 cm from the top edge. Top and bottom edges appear intact; nature of break across the right edge unclear as buried in the ground. The stone is also cracked across the middle. The stone is preserved in re-use in the front of the scaenae frons, as part of the facing to an access staircase from the floor of the orchestra to the stage.

layout.p: The beginning of two lines of monumental letters are preserved on the stone. A substantial left margin is preserved at the start of each line. Unless the lines below were substantially further indented, there was no text below; the preserved vacat above line 1 (90mm)  is significantly greater than that between lines 1 and 2 (57mm), so it is unclear if another line originally stood above (the top of the stone appears intact) - if it did, it was either significantly above the preserved first line and/or indented several letters to the right.

handNote.lettering: Deep, very regular, v-cut letters, with a broad v-cut, hair-line extensions to wedge serifs, and a quite wide square module. The I in line one is extended.

provenanceFound._: The stone is in situ in ancient re-use in the facing of a staircase leading from the orchestra to the stage

facsimile.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo J. Prag 2024-03-19

museum.name: Teatro Romano di Catania
museum.description: Small antiquarium with finds from the site, principally sculpture with some architectural elements

location.address: Greek-Roman Theatre, Via Vittorio Emanuele 266, 95124 - Catania (CT)

bibl.author: Korhonen
bibl.title: La cultura epigrafica della colonia di Catina nell'alto impero
